content: onto a tapestry needle insert needle from back to front emerging at the outside of work piece at the location you want your knot and pull through about 6 inches of yarn holding the needle in your right hand pinch the yarn with your left hand halfway between your work piece and the needle while holding light gauge with your left hand take your needle and place the side of it against the tensioned yarn with your left hand wrap the tensioned yarn around the needle the desired number of times more wraps makes a bigger knot do not wind too tightly or you will not be able to pull your needle through insert the point of the wrapped needle still holding the yarn in your left hand back into your work piece next to the spot it came out but not through the same hole i like to split the yarn of an adjacent stitch so that you don t see a gap between the start and finish of the knot keep hold on the yarn with your left hand and pull the yarn through until the knot is tight letting go just at the end see images at right saucer section make one using gray yarn round 1 magic_ring 6 or chain 2 then work 6 single_crochet into 1st st - 6 sts if using magic_ring pull center hole mostly closed but still loose you ll need to leave space for much embroidery to pass through it round 2 2 single_crochet in each st - 12 sts round 3 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 6 times - 18 sts round 4 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 2 sts 6 times - 24 sts round 5 single_crochet in next 3 sts 2 single_crochet in next st 6 times - 30 sts round 6 single_crochet in next st 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 3 st 6 times - 36 sts round 7 single_crochet in next 5 sts 2 single_crochet in next st 6 times - 42 sts round 8 in blo single_crochet in next 2 sts inv decrease single_crochet in next 3 sts 6 times - 36 sts round 9 inv decrease single_crochet in next 4 sts 6 times - 30 sts round 10 inv decrease single_crochet in next 3 sts 6 times - 24 sts round 11 inv decrease single_crochet in next 2 sts 6 times - 18 sts round 12 inv decrease single_crochet in next st 6 times - 12 sts stuff the saucer lightly before continuing round 13 inv decrease around - 6 sts cut yarn leaving a 16 tail use a tapestry needle to thread yarn through each of the stitches in the last round and pull the hole closed but still loose like top side insert needle through center and all the way through the saucer pulling through center hole of top side pull yarn with enough gauge to flatten the saucer but not too
